dt: {bc}strongly moved by love and especially sexual love

quotes.t: Vickers has now turned his formidable powers to "A Lover's Complaint". This 329-line {qword}amorous{/qword} oration was published with the Sonnets in 1609, though it is probably little read even by those for whom the sonnets are a form of poetic oxygen.
The first commercial valentines were produced in the U.S. in 1834 by one Robert H. Elton, and the custom of sending greeting cards with {qword}amorous{/qword} messages has persisted.
His {qword}amorous{/qword} affairs he flaunted as if they were masterpieces, and he invited his marital partner to share in the esthetic experience.

et: Middle English {it}amorous, amerous,{/it} borrowed from Anglo-French {it}amerous, amerus, amorous{/it} (continental Old French {it}amoreus, amorous{/it}), going back to Vulgar Latin {it}*amōrōsus,{/it} from Latin {it}amōr-, amor{/it} "love" + {it}-ōsus{/it} {et_link|-ous|-ous} {ma}{mat|amour|}{/ma}
shortdef: strongly moved by love and especially sexual love
being in love : enamored —usually used with of
